# collisionBoundingPath

**Instance Property**

The path-based shape to use for the collision bounds.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional var collisionBoundingPath: UIBezierPath { get }
```

## Discussion

When the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItem/collisionBoundsType] property is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItemCollisionBoundsType/path], the object in this property is used as the collision bounds. If your dynamic item implements the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItem/collisionBoundsType] property, you must also implement this property.

The path object you create must represent a convex polygon with counter-clockwise or clockwise winding, and the path must not intersect itself. The (0, 0) point of the path must be located at the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItem/center] point of the corresponding dynamic item. If the center point does not match the path’s origin, collision behaviors may not work as expected.

## Participating in dynamic animation

- **bounds**: Called when a dynamic animator needs the bounds of the dynamic item.
- **center**: The center point of the dynamic item.
- **transform**: The rotation of the dynamic item.
- **collisionBoundsType**: The type of collision bounds associated with the item.
